001
002/**
003 * La classe CommandWords permet de stocker toutes les commandes, d'avoir la liste des commandes et de vÃ©rifier si une commande est dans la liste.
004 */
005public class CommandWords
006{
007    /**
008     * Une liste contenant les commandes valident.
009     */
010    private final String[] aValidCommands;
011
012    /**
013     * Constructor - initialise the command words.
014     */
015    public CommandWords()
016    {
017        this.aValidCommands = new String[12];
018        this.aValidCommands[0] = "go";
019        this.aValidCommands[1] = "help";
020        this.aValidCommands[2] = "quit";
021        this.aValidCommands[3] = "look";
022        this.aValidCommands[4] = "eat";
023        this.aValidCommands[5] = "back";
024        this.aValidCommands[6] = "test";
025        this.aValidCommands[7] = "take";
026        this.aValidCommands[8] = "drop";
027        this.aValidCommands[9] = "inventory";
028        this.aValidCommands[10] = "charge";
029        this.aValidCommands[11] = "fire";
030    } // CommandWords()
031
032    /**
033     * Check whether a given String is a valid command word. 
034     * @param pString La commande a vÃ©rifier.
035     * @return true if a given string is a valid command,
036     * false if it isn't.
037     */
038    public boolean isCommand( final String pString )
039    {
040        for ( int vI=0; vI<this.aValidCommands.length; vI++ ) {
041            if ( this.aValidCommands[vI].equals( pString ) )
042                return true;
043        } // for
044        // if we get here, the string was not found in the commands :
045        return false;
046    } // isCommand()
047    
048    /**
049     * Permet d'avoir toutes les commandes dans une chaine de caractÃ¨re.
050     * @return la chaine de caractÃ¨re.
051     */
052    public String getCommandList()
053    {
054        StringBuilder vCommands = new StringBuilder();
055        for(String vCommand : aValidCommands){
056            vCommands.append(vCommand+" ");
057        }
058        return vCommands.toString();
059    }
060} // CommandWords
